STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 7, 2023
Natasha Doan-Motsinger
Our House- Mosaic
111 S WALLACE BLVD,
YPSILANTI, MI, 48197-4644
Re: License #: CB810406448
SI#:2023C0000662SI
Dear Natasha Doan-Motsinger:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB810406448
Licensee Group Organization: Our House
Licensee Designee: Natasha Doan-Motsinger
Chief Administrator: Natasha Doan-Motsinger
Agency Name: Our House- Mosaic
Agency Address: 111 S WALLACE BLVD
YPSILANTI, MI 48197-4644
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 01/25/2024
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Contact
Method Purpose
7/31/2023 11:15 AM Email Other
7/31/2023 3:00 PM Phone Interview
8/1/2023 10:30 AM Onsite Other
Inspection
8/1/2023 11:00 AM Face to Face Interview
8/1/2023 11:20 AM Face to Face Interview
8/1/2023 11:45 AM Face to Face Interview
8/10/2023 3:10 PM Phone Interview
8/16/2023 2:30 PM Phone Pre-exit
meeting
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12505 Supervision
Section (1) An agency shall provide supervision for a youth in independent
Description living consistent with the youth’s need for supervision, as required
by R 400.12504(2)(e).
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency did not provide adequate supervision of Independent
Living Plus home that resulted in a youth being sexually
assaulted.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on August 11,
2023. She did not have any additional information to add.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via telephone on
July 31, 2023. CA was made aware of allegations being
investigated and was also asked about a few other recent
incidents. CA stated there has been ongoing conflict among some
of the youth in the independent living plus home (ILP). On July 26,
2023, there was an altercation between a group of 4-5 youths in
the ILP home. Youth C ended up throwing an object in the
direction of Youth A. She was arrested and removed from the ILP
program. The camera footage indicates the altercation was
provoked and once Youth C threw the object Youth A and Youth B
were viewed to be celebrating. Youth A was involved in an
incident involving Youth B and Youth C that is being investigated
by law enforcement and will most likely result in charges for Youth
A and Youth B. Youth A and Youth B were able to obtain an old
cell phone that belonged to Youth C. There were nude pictures of
Youth C on the phone. Youth A and Youth B distributed the
pictures to others, and they are now on the internet. On July 28,
2023, the following day after Youth A became aware of possible
criminal charges, she reported to Staff 1 that she had been
sexually assaulted. CA stated Staff 1 contacted her after Youth A
disclosed, she had been sexually assaulted but could not recall
when it happened. CA stated the agency has had staff present at
the ILP for all of the required hours which are 4pm-8am
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the agency on August
1, 2023. Staff 1 could not recall an instance when staff were not
present during the required hours of 4pm-8am. Staff 1 stated she
had heard about an incident regarding Youth C throwing objects
toward another youth, but she was not present. She stated Youth
C is no longer residing in the ILP house. She is also aware of an
incident where Youth B was able to obtain Youth C’s phone and
distributed nude pictures of Youth C that were on the phone.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the agency on August
1, 2023. Staff 2 stated there has not been an issue regarding staff
not being present for scheduled shifts. The agency has
maintained adequate staffing for the required hours of 4pm-8am.
Staff 2 stated the situation involved Youth A, Youth B, Youth C
2

and Youth D. The incident was instigated by Youth B but due to
Youth C throwing an object toward another youth she was
arrested and charged. Staff 2 was not present during the incident
but reviewed camera footage and also attended the initial court
hearing regarding the incident. She stated Youth A and Youth B
broke into Youth C’s bedroom and got ahold of Youth C’s phone
after she was arrested. There were nude pictures of Youth C on
the phone and Youth B allegedly distributed those and they are
now on the internet. Youth C used the find my phone feature and
it was located at the address of Youth B’s former foster placement
where he had reported staying that weekend. A police report was
filed.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the agency on August
1, 2023. Staff 3 could not recall an instance when staff were not
present during the required hours of 4pm-8am. Staff 3 reviewed
the camera footage regarding an incident involving Youth C
throwing an object toward another youth. They stated the object
did not make contact with anyone, but Youth C was arrested as a
result of the incident. Staff 3 stated she is aware of an incident
where Youth B took Youth C’s phone and was able to access
nude pictures of Youth C and then posted them on her social
media accounts and sent them to others.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on August 10, 2023.
She stated approximately three weeks ago she reported to
multiple staff at Our House that she had been sexually assaulted.
Youth A stated staff are present at the ILP house between the
hours of 4pm-8am. She stated she believes staff were present at
the ILP at the time of the incident but could not say for sure
because she was asleep and was told about it later by Youth B.
She stated Youth B told her that Youth D assaulted her but was
not able to provide any details due to being asleep at the time.
She stated she believes it was between the hours of 9pm-11pm.
When asked if she could recall what date this occurred, she was
not able to provide more details when it occurred. She stated staff
are present during the timeframe of 4pm-8pm.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on August 1, 2023.
The independent living house has bedrooms for youth on the first
floor and second floor. There were no concerns noted.
Documents reviewed:
• Staff schedule for ILP house for July 8, 2023-July 28, 2023,
that verifies coverage between the hours of 4pm-8am.
3

Analysis The agency is found in compliance. Based on completed
interviews and review of documentation there is no indication the
agency has not provided required staff coverage at the ILP house
during the hours of 4pm-8am.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12214 Compliance with 1975 PA 238
Section (1) An agency shall develop a written plan and implement the plan
Description to assure compliance with 1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621, and known
as the child protection law.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency become aware of allegations of child abuse/neglect
and did not report to Centralized Intake or law enforcement.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on August 11,
2023. She did not have any additional information to add.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via telephone on
July 31, 2023. CA stated there has been ongoing conflict among
some of the youth in the independent living plus home (ILP).
Youth A was involved in an incident involving another youth that is
being investigated by law enforcement and will most likely result in
charges for Youth A and the other youth. On July 28, 2023, the
following day after Youth A became aware of possible criminal
charges, she reported to Staff 1 that she had been sexually
assaulted. CA stated that Staff 1 contacted her after Youth A
disclosed, she had been sexually assaulted but could not recall
when it happened. CA reached out to Youth A to inquire if she
wanted to speak with law enforcement, needed medical support,
mental health support. CA stated Youth A refused to speak with
law enforcement or go to the hospital. CA stated that since Youth
A is 17 and is at the age of consent, she can also make the
decision whether or not she wants to report the sexual assault. CA
contacted two attorneys who agreed with her, and the agency
attempted to safety plan with Youth A and the alleged perpetrator
of the sexual assault. CA spoke with Youth A via telephone on
July 30, 2023, and again asked if she would be willing to speak to
law enforcement, mental health or medical care and she declined.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the agency on August
1, 2023. Staff 1 stated Youth A reported to her on July 28, 2023,
that she had been sexually assaulted. Youth A was asked
questions in order to obtain more information, however, she did
not provide any additional information. Staff 1 stated that she
immediately contacted CA who is her supervisor and advised her
of the disclosure.
4

Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the agency on August
1, 2023. Staff 2 stated she became aware of Youth A making the
statement that she had been sexually assaulted from Staff 3. Staff
2 stated Staff 3 reported they were on-site at the ILP house on
July 28, 2023. On July 29, 2023, Staff 3 was on-call and received
a call from another staff person who was told by Youth A that she
had been sexually assaulted. Staff 2 stated she contacted CA on
July 29, 2023, and informed her of what had been reported. On
July 30, 2023, she was contacted by staff who let her know that
law enforcement was at the ILP house. Law enforcement was
present for another issue involving another youth but became
aware of the sexual assault allegations at that time. Staff 2 stated
law enforcement was upset the agency had not reported the
allegations.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the agency on August
1, 2023. Staff 3 stated at end of shift on July 28, 2023, Youth A
reported she had been sexually assaulted a few days ago. Staff 3
stated they immediately reported the allegations to Staff 2. Staff 3
stated they immediately contacted CA who is their supervisor and
advised them of the disclosure.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on August 10, 2023.
She stated approximately three weeks ago she reported to
multiple staff at Our House that she had been sexually assaulted.
When asked if she could clarify which staff, she reported the
concerns to, she stated she informed CA and a few other staff that
were present but could not recall which staff.
Documents reviewed:
• Agency incident report includes the date, time and location
of the incident, youth involved, and asks if Centralized
Intake was contact, DHHS Monitor, and GAL. The agency
did not complete an incident report in this situation.
• Agency participant contract states the agency and youth
responsibilities. There is nothing that relates to reporting
incident of abuse/neglect.
• Agency code of conduct states prohibited behaviors include
unwelcome physical contact and known sexual abuse or
neglect of a child. The form states any unacceptable
behavior will result in warning and/or disciplinary action
including suspension or termination from the program.
• Agency handbook/policies states all staff must report any
suspected child abuse and/or neglect of agency clients or
program participants immediately. In addition, all
5

employees are required to undergo training as to what
constitutes child abuse and neglect, what the state statutes
are, and how to properly report such cases.
• ILP staff training plan lists mandate reporting training.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance. Based on completed
interviews at least four different staff were made aware of
allegations of child abuse/neglect and did not report the concerns
to Centralized Intake or law enforcement.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
__________9/7/2023____________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 7, 2023
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
6
